title: Greatest Common Factor
text: The greatest common factor amongst the three terms in the expression is $$1$$. So we need to use other approaches.

title: Perfect square
text: Is the first term of the expression a perfect square? How do you rewrite $$9x^2$$ as a perfect square?

title: Perfect square
text: Is the last term in the expression a perfect square? How do you rewrite $$16y^2$$ as a perfect square?

title: Formula
text: We can rewrite the expression $$9x^2-24x y+16y^2={\left(3x\right)}^2-24x y+{\left(4y\right)}^2$$. Does it fit the pattern $$a^2-2a b+b^2$$?

title: Finding $$x$$
text: If $$9x^2-24x y+16y^2={\left(3x\right)}^2-24x y+{\left(4y\right)}^2$$ fits the pattern $$a^2-2a b+b^2$$, then what is a?

title: Finding $$y$$
text: If $$9x^2-24x y+16y^2={\left(3x\right)}^2-24x y+{\left(4y\right)}^2$$ fits the pattern $$a^2-2a b+b^2$$, then what is $$b$$?

title: Finding 2xy
text: If $$a=3x$$ and $$b=4y$$, then what is $$2a b$$?

title: Find the pattern
text: If we let $$a=3x$$ and $$b=4y$$, and $$2a b=24x y$$, then $$a^2-2a b+b^2=9x^2-24x y+16y^2$$.

title: Factor first term
text: Given that $$a^2-2a b+b^2=2\left(a-b\right)$$, how do we factor $$9x^2-24x y+16y^2$$?

subHints.title: Rewrite
subHints.text: Based on the above steps, we observe that if $$a=3x$$ and $$b=4y$$, then $$3x^2-24x y+16y^2$$ fits the pattern $$a^2-2a b+b^2$$. Given that $$a^2-2a b+b^2=2\left(a-b\right)$$, how do we rewrite $$9x^2-24x y+16y^2$$ as a perfect square?
